episodes.title: Why Weren’t Epstein Co-Conspirators Charged? Epstein Victim Lawyer Gloria Allred Explains
episodes.description:
Renowned civil-rights attorney Gloria Allred joins Brian Shapiro on Pushing the Limits for a powerful, wide-ranging interview on the Jeffrey Epstein files, the Department of Justice’s handling of survivor information, and what she calls a profound failure of accountability. 

Allred, who has represented 27 Epstein survivors, explains why the DOJ violated the Epstein Files Transparency Act, why victims’ names were wrongly published, and how the botched release has retraumatized survivors. She also addresses the lack of charges against alleged Epstein co-conspirators, conflicting statements from DOJ officials, and growing concerns that justice is being obstructed to protect powerful figures.

Brian presses Allred on allegations involving Donald Trump, Bill Clinton, and others named in the files, the suspicious death of Epstein, and why transparency matters more than politics. Throughout the conversation, Allred makes one thing clear: this should never be about party loyalty — it must be about justice for the victims.

This is a must-watch legal breakdown from one of the most influential attorneys in America.

🔔 Subscribe for more interviews, investigations, and political commentary from Pushing the Limits.
💬 Comment below: Do you trust the DOJ to fully release the Epstein files?

episodes.title: Trump supporters are in revolt over the Epstein Files with Special Guest Mark Epstein
episodes.description: Pushing the Limits with Brian Shaipro is a thought-provoking podcast that delves into the most pressing issues of the day, offering a fresh perspective on the world we live in. The show is hosted by Brian Shaipro, who is joined by a diverse range of guests, including experts, activists, and thought leaders. In Season 1, Episode 1, Brian Shaipro tackles the complex and intriguing topic of the Jeffrey Epstein case, its connections to Donald Trump, and the broader implications for the MAGA movement. The episode features in-depth interviews with Mark Epstein, Jeffrey Epstein's brother, and Ron Filipkowski, a journalist from Midas Touch. Mark Epstein shares his insights on the recent video released by Pam Bondi, stating, "This is more BS... What are they hiding? Why is Pam Bondi and Donald Trump not wanting to talk about your brother anymore? All of a sudden, what are they hiding?" Ron Filipkowski adds, "I think a lot of what Bongino is doing is very self-serving... It's really all about him." The episode provides a nuanced exploration of the Epstein case, its connections to high-profile figures, and the reactions of the MAGA movement. The conversation also touches on Donald Trump's recent press conference, where he announced plans to impose secondary tariffs on Russia in fifty days. Ron Filipkowski criticizes this move, saying, "The Kremlin is laughing at this fifty-day thing that was put in place by Trump earlier today. Fifty days are going to go by. Nothing is going to change. And then Donald Trump won't want to talk about Vladimir Putin in the war in Ukraine no more than he wants to talk about the Jeffrey Epstein files." Brian Shaipro and Ron Filipkowski discuss the implications of Trump's actions, highlighting the lack of concrete measures to address the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. The hosts also examine the broader context of Trump's presidency, including his handling of foreign policy and the economy. Ron Filipkowski notes, "We're headed towards a recession. People are going to be losing their medical coverage and Medicaid, maybe upwards of fifteen to twenty million people. People are losing their jobs. They're suffering in this country." The conversation highlights the disconnect between Trump's rhetoric and the reality on the ground, with many Americans struggling to make ends meet. The episode also touches on the topic of trans rights, with Brian Shaipro criticizing the MAGA movement for prioritizing issues like trans athletes over more pressing concerns like economic inequality. Ron Filipkowski adds, "They want to ban books. They want to attack the LGBTQ community. They want to attack trans people. And they think drag queens are bad and undocumented immigrants are the reasons why there's so much crime in this country, which couldn't be further from the truth." The conversation highlights the divisive tactics employed by the MAGA movement and the need for a more nuanced and inclusive approach to addressing social issues. Throughout the episode, Brian Shaipro and his guests offer a critical perspective on the Trump administration and the MAGA movement, highlighting the need for greater accountability and transparency. The conversation is marked by a sense of urgency and concern, as the hosts and their guests grapple with the complex and often disturbing implications of Trump's actions. As the episode comes to a close, Brian Shaipro reflects on the importance of continuing the conversation and pushing the limits of what is possible in pursuit of a more just and equitable society. The episode is a thought-provoking exploration of the most pressing issues of our time, and it sets the stage for a nuanced and in-depth examination of the Trump administration and its impact on American society. With its diverse range of guests and topics, Pushing the Limits with Brian Shaipro is a must-listen for anyone seeking to stay informed and engaged on the most critical issues of our time. The show's commitment to critical thinking and nuanced analysis makes it a valuable resource for anyone looking to deepen their understanding of the world we live in.
